alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 630 PM MDT... At 556 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles west of Kit Carson, or 41 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse and Aroya. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: out of the area If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
